skill.name: pr-prepare
skill.description: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, pull request, ready for PR, draft PR, write PR
skill.summary: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, p...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only workflow instructions and markdown templates for PR preparation. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating quality PR descriptions takes time and consistency. This skill automates PR preparation by gathering git context, analyzing changes, and generating standardized descriptions following project templates with conventional commit formatting.
actual_capabilities: Gather git context using status, log, and diff commands
Analyze code changes to identify components and impact
Generate standardized PR descriptions from templates
Suggest PR titles following conventional commits format
Validate PR descriptions meet project standards
limitations: Does not create actual pull requests on remote repositories
Does not modify or commit code changes
Does not execute tests or validation scripts
Requires an initialized git repository to function

use_cases.title: Standardize PR descriptions
use_cases.description: Generate consistent, complete PR descriptions that help reviewers understand changes quickly

use_cases.title: Enforce PR standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow the same PR format with required sections and testing checklists

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Guide contributors to provide better PR descriptions that reduce review time

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare the PR for this branch with a summary, changes list, impact, and testing checklist

prompt_templates.title: With git context
prompt_templates.prompt: Run git status, diff, and log to gather context then prepare a complete PR description following our project template

prompt_templates.title: Feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR description for this feature branch including what changed, why, and the impact on users

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR description for this bug fix. Include the problem, solution, and testing approach

output_examples.input: Prepare the PR for this branch
output: Suggested Title: feat: add user authentication with OAuth2
Summary: Add OAuth2 authentication supporting Google and GitHub providers
Impact: Users can sign in with Google or GitHub, secure session management, no breaking changes

best_practices: Include specific file paths and components in each change description
Always verify tests and linting pass before creating PRs
Add follow-up items as notes for future work
anti_patterns: Using vague titles without conventional commit prefix
Omitting testing validation from PR descriptions
Failing to document breaking changes or migration steps

faq.question: Which git commands does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses git status, git log with merge-base, and git diff to gather context about branch changes.

faq.question: Can it create the PR on GitHub?
faq.answer: No, the skill prepares the description text. Users must run gh pr create or use GitHub UI to submit.

faq.question: Does it support GitLab or Bitbucket?
faq.answer: The template is generic enough for any Git provider. Output format works on all platforms.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads git information locally. No code or data is sent anywhere.

faq.question: What if git commands fail?
faq.answer: If commands fail, the skill will report the error. Ensure you are in a git repository with changes.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub templates?
faq.answer: GitHub templates are static files. This skill actively analyzes your changes and generates custom descriptions.
